title: Capstone Project: The Autonomous Humanoid
content:
--- title: "Capstone Project: The Autonomous Humanoid" summary: "Integrate your knowledge from the entire textbook to build a simulated autonomous humanoid robot that can navigate its environment and interact with objects." tags: [capstone, project, humanoid-robotics, autonomous-systems, ros2] keywords: [capstone, project, humanoid-robotics, autonomous-systems, ros, nav2, moveit, perception, grasping] learningObjectives: - "Apply the concepts learned throughout the textbook to a large-scale project." - "Gain experience in system integration and debugging." - "Develop a complete, autonomous robotics application from scratch." prerequisites: ["All previous chapters"] outcome: "Readers will have a fully functional simulated humanoid robot that demonstrates a wide range of autonomous capabilities." successCriteria: - "Successfully build and launch the humanoid robot simulation." - "Command the robot to navigate to a specified location in the environment." - "Command the robot to pick up and place an object." toolsUsed: [ROS 2, Gazebo, Nav2, MoveIt] relatedConcepts: [systems-engineering, project-management, software-architecture, robotics] --- import Prerequisites from '@site/src/components/Prerequisites'; import LearningObjective from '@site/src/components/LearningObjective'; import Outcome from '@site/src/components/Outcome'; import SuccessCriteria from '@site/src/components/SuccessCriteria'; import Exercise from '@site/src/components/Exercise'; import Checkpoint from '@site/src/components/Checkpoint'; # Capstone Project: The Autonomous Humanoid This capstone project is your opportunity to bring together everything you have learned in this textbook to build a complete autonomous humanoid robot.

You should have completed all the previous chapters and exercises in this textbook.
  • Apply the concepts learned throughout the textbook to a large-scale project.
  • Gain experience in system integration and debugging.
  • Develop a complete, autonomous robotics application from scratch.
 ## Project Goal The goal of this project is to build and program a simulated humanoid robot that can: 1. Navigate autonomously in a cluttered indoor environment. 2. Perceive objects in its environment. 3. Pick up a specified object. 4. Place the object at a specified location. ## Project Phases This project is divided into four phases: ### Phase 1: Robot Design and Simulation In this phase, you will design the URDF model for your humanoid robot and create a Gazebo world for it to live in. Your robot should have at least two arms with grippers, a head with a camera, and a mobile base. ### Phase 2: Navigation In this phase, you will integrate the Nav2 stack to give your robot the ability to navigate autonomously. You will need to configure the costmaps, planners, and controllers for a humanoid robot. ### Phase 3: Perception In this phase, you will add a perception system to your robot. This will involve using a pre-trained object detection model to identify objects in the camera feed. ### Phase 4: Manipulation In this phase, you will use MoveIt to control the robot's arms. You will write a script that uses the output of your perception system to plan and execute a pick-and-place task.

What are the four main phases of the capstone project?

This entire project is an exercise! Good luck!

Congratulations! You have built a complete autonomous humanoid robot. You have gained valuable experience in all aspects of robotics software development, from low-level control to high-level AI. You are now well-equipped to tackle a wide range of challenges in the exciting field of robotics.
  • Successfully build and launch the humanoid robot simulation.
  • Command the robot to navigate to a specified location in the environment.
  • Command the robot to pick up and place an object.
